revised_title: Aerolite Fall and Meteorological Observations in Tunisia
tldr: In November 1849, a fall of aerolites occurred on the coast of Barbary, accompanied by a brilliant stream of light stretching from Tunis to Tripoli. The event caused alarm among the inhabitants, and the following winter was the coldest in years. This letter from Mr. Richardson to Viscount Palmerston provides information on the phenomenon and its impact.
